title: Define Project Scope and Requirements - Revised
description: This RFC outlines the detailed requirements for the SecureConfigurationManager system. The scope covers management of security configurations across an organization's IT infrastructure, including (but not limited to): network devices, servers, applications, databases, and endpoints. The system will be designed to enforce security policies and standards in accordance with best practices and industry regulations. Key requirements include: configuration templates, real-time monitoring, alerting, and reporting, as well as integrations with existing IT management tools. This RFC is open for feedback and suggestions.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall architecture of the SecureConfigurationManager system, including the components, modules, and their interactions, as well as the data models and storage mechanisms.

title: Develop Security Policies and Standards
description: Define and document the comprehensive security policies, standards, and best practices that will be enforced by the SecureConfigurationManager system. This should cover various aspects such as access control, data encryption, network security, system hardening, vulnerability management, incident response, and compliance with relevant industry standards and regulations. Additionally, consider integrating feedback from the project team and incorporate any suggestions for improvement into the final document.

title: Design User Interface and Reporting
description: Design the user interface and reporting mechanisms for the SecureConfigurationManager system, including the dashboards, configuration management tools, and reporting capabilities.

title: Implement Core System Components
description: Develop and implement the core components of the SecureConfigurationManager system, including the configuration management engine, security policy enforcement mechanisms, and integration with infrastructure components.

title: Develop Data Storage and Management
description: Implement the data storage and management mechanisms for the SecureConfigurationManager system, including the configuration data models, storage solutions, and data access layers.

title: Implement User Interface and Reporting
description: Develop the user interface and reporting components of the SecureConfigurationManager system, including the dashboards, configuration management tools, and reporting mechanisms.

title: Integrate with Infrastructure Components
description: Integrate the SecureConfigurationManager system with the organization's IT infrastructure components, such as servers, network devices, and cloud services, to enable configuration management and enforcement.

title: Develop Testing and Validation Strategies
description: Define and implement testing and validation strategies for the SecureConfigurationManager system, including unit tests, integration tests, and security testing.

title: Conduct System Testing and Validation
description: Perform comprehensive testing and validation of the SecureConfigurationManager system, including functional testing, performance testing, and security testing.

title: Prepare Documentation and Training Materials
description: Develop comprehensive documentation and training materials for the SecureConfigurationManager system, including user guides, administration manuals, and training resources.

title: Deploy and Implement System
description: Deploy and implement the SecureConfigurationManager system across the organization's IT infrastructure, including configuration, integration, and user training.
